form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Blunt (for himself and Mr. Casey) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to adequately fund bridges in the United States.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Support for Bridges Act.

section.header: Restoration of funding for bridges on Federal-aid highways

subsection.text: Section 104(b)(1) of title 23, United States Code, is amended by striking 63.7 percent and inserting 49 percent.
Section 104(b)(2) of title 23, United States Code, is amended by striking 29.3 percent and inserting 44 percent.

section.text: Section 133(g) of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking highway the first place it appears; and

subparagraph.text: by striking except that amounts allocated under subsection (d) shall not be obligated and inserting except that amounts allocated under subsection (d)(1)(A) shall not be used.
